sentence.idiomatic: After comparing, she still decided to buy this one.
When buying something, it's best to do a lot of comparing.
You have compared so many products, haven't you made a decision yet?
Their service attitude is very good.
Your work attitude is unacceptable.
We need to use a scientific approach to handle this matter.
She is in a pretty good mood today.
I can understand the mood you're in.
I'm not in the mood to listen to you.
He has liked telling lies since he was a child.
Everyone lies at some point.
Don't allow children to develop the habit of telling lies.
Hurry up, he is waiting impatiently.
That shop clerk looks impatient.
She answered our questions impatiently.
You've been tying to choose that long and yet still haven't decided?
The present you chose is very good. I really like it.
She is good at picking things out.
I don't know where they went shopping.
Let's go out for a stroll.
They have all gone out shopping.
How do you think it will look when she puts it on?
This clothing looks good on you.
If you don't try it on, you won't know how it looks on you.
Zhang Liang, does this one look good?
Very nice, try it on.
I want to look at some other things too. Oooh, what about that one?
Uh-huh, it’s pretty good. If you like it you should try it on, otherwise you won’t know how it looks on you.
Well, when you’re buying clothes you have to look around a lot to be able to choose the best ones. Ah, this one is also really nice. What do you think?
It's pretty good. If you like it, just buy it. I really don't get women, so picky – looking at this, looking at that. In the end, they don't even buy anything.
You’re so impatient! You don’t want to spend time with me, is that it? Just admit it.
Lili, what’s the matter? The happiest time of every day is when I’m with you.
You’re lying! You obviously don’t want to shop. Now I don’t feel like it either. Let’s go home.
OK, OK. I have the wrong attitude. Don’t be angry. You’re right, when you’re shopping for clothes you need to look around a lot and compare. Let’s go back upstairs and take a look.
I don’t want to go. Go look for yourself.
